Posts.Content: Jul 12, 2008 06:39AM kbugmom wrote: Amber sending you a big hug....I had a ct earlier this week showed some progression of my lung mets. For a day I was stressed and then I grabbed hold tight to my faith. It is not easy but we keep fighting . My dr. asked me did I have any plans for a vacation if so we would work around it. I said no I went to Disney a few months ago. Talk to dr about maybe a couple week break then start back. Try not to be off of chemo for long since we are in a battle. My kids are all grown but I have grandkids I try to spend lots of time with. Next week is my week off chemo so I got em today for a week to spoil. So it keeps me in bc butt kicking mood. Hugs and prayers

But he knows and is working this for his glory. In this walk we can show his love by helping others. Look how ctg showed us her love and helped us even though she was hurting also. She always had time for others. We can be a light to someone else. Volunteer or do something even in a small way for others. I started making prayer shawls and also prayer dishcloths. Posts.Content: kbugmom wrote: Got the call that last scan results not good. I have progression with some lung mets and a new one. 1. something. More bone mets now on rib. Spot on liver a lil bigger. Did not know about liver even though drs were watching small spot. I was not told then. I hate cancer.............. I go to dr tomorrow and will go over results better and decide next drug. I believe God still heals and he has not said he is not going to. I am so mad and frustrated with bc. Thinking of my kids and grands. One son is in Okinawa serving in marines. So far away and I have to tell him. I want to protect my pain from them . Emotional pain mostly. Just needed to vent. I love you all my dear sisters. God bless. Susan Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: May 17, 2009 02:52PM kbugmom wrote: I had rads to spine for bone mets. I started to feel bad about day 8. They said that is normal to feel sick. By the last one I was in pain and could not eat or drink without crying. I lost lots of weight. Ate pudding or jello or a lil of it. My pain was the rads screwed my esophogus and tummy up. I still have days where there is discomfort. Talk with your dr about shortness of breath probably a se from rads. Hang in there it is not always pleasant or fun. God bless. Susan

Posts.Title: Weight and Appetite Loss TripleNeg curlieqs

Posts.Content: Sep 8, 2008 10:29AM kbugmom wrote: Having a port makes it so much easier. I also have a power port like Watson. I was dx with lung mets 2 and a half yrs ago. It looks like I had it with my first dx of bc. I am now on gemzar and avastin. Have been for almost 14 moths. There can be a bp issue with the avastin and I am on bp meds now. Foods taste gross day after. Maybe it is just me. I have also had alot of sinus problems since I started this chemo. I have lots of sinus drainage which makes me cough alot. They think it is a se of meds. I do most of what I did before dx. A good positive attitude is a must. Also I have a strong faith in the good Lord. It is doable so keep looking up and you will do great. Hugs and prayers to you.....

It really helps him. Of course he has always loved the super silly stuff he is out nut in the bunch... So hang in there for we can not allow cancer to have power in us. Posts.Content: Mar 18, 2009 10:17PM kbugmom wrote: I am on zometa and abraxane. I have had abraxane alone and still two days later I get the pain. I get leg pain more than anywhere else. Now I do have some in other areas but my legs will be my biggest pains. It starts two days after chemo till 4 or 5 days after. It kinda feels like someone grabs a nerve in leg and pinches it off and on. I dont sleep hardly those few days. I  need to ask dr next week about it. Nothing I take helps the pain when it does this. God bless keep us posted. Susan
Posts.Title: Abraxane Pain EnergizerBunny saint

Posts.Content: Jun 26, 2008 10:28AM kbugmom wrote: Hello Tomatojuice,      I start the day after chemo having a problem also . I feel as though I have to pee all the time. It usually only last a day. Sometimes a lil leakage. I have told the dr. a number of times and she says your drugs should not cause it. I have been on gemazar and avastin for almost eleven months. Have not had the problem with other chemos. I found out that decadron can cause it. So who really knows for sure. It is worse for me when I get both drugs. On the week I only get gemzar not so bad. GOD bless.
